5. Crypto Operations¶

Here are some examples for what you can do with this submodule

optigatrust.crypto.random(n, trng=True)¶

This function generates a random number

Variables

  • n (int) – how much randomness to generate. Valid values are from 8 to 256

  • trng (bool) – If True the a True Random Generator will be used, otherwise Deterministic Random Number Generator

Raises

  • TypeError - when any of the parameters are of the wrong type

  • OSError - when an error is returned by the chip initialisation library

Returns

Bytes object with randomness

class optigatrust.crypto.ECCKey(key_id: int, curve='secp256r1')¶
ecdsa_sign(data)¶

This function signs given data based on the provided EccKey object

Parameters

data – Data to sign, the data will be hashed based on the used curve. If secp256r1 then sha256, secp384r1 sha384 etc.

Raises

  • TypeError - when any of the parameters are of the wrong type

  • OSError - when an error is returned by the core initialisation library

Returns

EcdsaSignature object or None

generate(curve='secp256r1', key_usage=None, export=False)¶

This function generates an ECC keypair, the private part is stored on the core based on the provided slot

Variables

  • curve (str) – Curve name, should be one of supported by the chip curves. For instance m3 has the widest range of supported algorithms: secp256r1, secp384r1, secp521r1, brainpoolp256r1, brainpoolp384r1, brainpoolp512r1

  • key_usage (str) – Key usage defined per string. Can be selected as following: [‘key_agreement’, ‘authentication’, ‘encryption’, ‘signature’]

  • export (bool) – Indicates whether the private key should be exported

Raises

  • TypeError - when any of the parameters are of the wrong type

  • OSError - when an error is returned by the core initialisation library

Returns

EccKey object or None

class optigatrust.crypto.RSAKey(key_id: int)¶
generate(key_size=1024, key_usage=None, export=False)¶

This function generates an RSA keypair, the private part is stored on the core based on the provided slot

Variables

  • key_size (int) – Size of the key, can be 1024 or 2048

  • key_usage (list) – Key usage defined per string. Can be selected as following: [‘key_agreement’, ‘authentication’, ‘encryption’, ‘signature’]

  • export (bool) – Indicates whether the private key should be exported

Raises

  • TypeError - when any of the parameters are of the wrong type

  • OSError - when an error is returned by the core initialisation library

Returns

RsaKey object or None

pkcs1v15_sign(data: bytes, hash_algorithm='sha256')¶

This function signs given data based on the provided RsaKey object

Parameters

  • data – Data to sign

  • hash_algorithm – Hash algorithm which should be used to sign data. SHA256 by default

Raises

  • TypeError - when any of the parameters are of the wrong type

  • OSError - when an error is returned by the core initialisation library

Returns

RsaPkcs1v15Signature object or None

class optigatrust.crypto.ECDSASignature(hash_alg, key_id, signature)¶
class optigatrust.crypto.PKCS1v15Signature(hash_alg, keyid, signature)¶
